Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கவ்வையால் கவ்விது காமம் அதுவின்றேல்தவ்வென்னும் தன்மை இழந்து.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The rumour rising makes my love to rise; My love would lose its power and languish otherwise.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: The love between two people ('Kaamam') is visualized as a vibrant, growing plant.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The rumor and gossip of the town ('Kavvai') are depicted as falling rain or nutrients that, instead of harming the plant, make it grow stronger, more vibrant, and more beautiful ('Kavvithu').
Layered_Composition.Background: In a contrasting corner of the image, a similar plant is shown without the 'rain' of rumor, and it is wilting and losing its color ('Thanmai Izhanthu'), looking bland and weak.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A metaphor showing that rumor, rather than destroying love, actually nourishes it and makes it more intense and flavorful. Without the scandal, love would become bland.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: Love as a plant. Rumor as nourishing rain. The wilting plant represents love without the 'spice' of public rumor.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The main scene is vibrant and lush, with the 'rain' of rumor depicted as sparkling, life-giving drops. The wilting plant is in a desaturated, dull-colored space.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Symbolic wide shot that clearly shows the cause-and-effect relationship between the rumor-rain and the thriving love-plant.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, surreal realism, with beautiful, detailed plant life and magical water effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Bright, magical lighting that makes the main plant look supernaturally healthy.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Allegorical nature painting, using natural elements to represent emotions.

Cultural_Anchors: The idea that opposition strengthens love
